intro: [WRONG START] Pulla papuana, commonly known as the Papuan pullea, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands, particularly Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
